channel.title: [PHP] A button to run a function on the same page?
channel.description:
Is it possible in php to make a button on a php page run a function. like:
[code] <form action="myFunction();" method="post"> <input type="submit" /> </form> [/code]
Meh :cool:

item.title: [PHP] A button to run a function on the same page?
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

use either ajax
or make the page redirect to itself and have the php script execute it a hidden post var is set

Read full topic
item.source: [PHP] A button to run a function on the same page?

item.title: [PHP] A button to run a function on the same page?
item.dc:creator: @ThatOneServer Mike_
item.description:
@ThatOneServer wrote:

php = server side.
javascript = client side

Think of php asâ€¦ a brain.
It asks questions (if statements, etc.) and does things(replace, etc) and then tells the person next to it. The person next to it has no idea what the brain was thinking.
